</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Research-Problem:">Research Problem:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Research-Problem:">Â¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>Using students' first semester of data, identify if students will return for a 3rd semester </li>
<li>The goal is to intervene early to provide students with resources, to increase retention</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Data">Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data">Â¶</a></h2><p>The enrollment table has 2,293,687 rows and 16 columns. The awards table has 30,429 rows and 4 columns. The miscellaneous table has 198,981 rows and 12 columns.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The inital data needed to be cleaned. The data was exported using SPSS so many of the data types did not agree, even within a column, i.e. half of the wdegapp (1 if the class is applicable to degree 0 otherwise) values 1 and 0 were integers, and the other were strings. Thus, the first thing I did was each column to its appropriate data types.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [82]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># award.head()</span>
<span class="c1"># misc.head(4)</span>
<span class="c1"># enrollment.iloc[190000:190005]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [83]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_option</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'display.max_columns'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">300</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">enrollments</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="sd">''' Enrollment dataframe seems to contain empty columns. </span>
<span class="sd">These columns are likely to be for the list of courses.</span>
<span class="sd">We will search for when the student data begins **</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="n">enrollments</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">183760</span><span class="p">:]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#The data seems to start on the 183766th row</span>

<span class="n">enrollment</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollments</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">183766</span><span class="p">:]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Let's make sure that the number of student data given is consistent across the tables</span>

<span class="sd">''' There seems to be a problem and mismatch in the amount of information given on students between</span>
<span class="sd">the misc and enrollment dataset. One possibility is the dtype of the columns. </span>
<span class="sd">We will convert the column types and see if that helps.</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="n">misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="sd">''' That seem to have fixed the issue. </span>
<span class="sd">However, it seems like the data has different dtypes within the column so we will convert each </span>
<span class="sd">column one by one to the correct dtype to work with.</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="n">dtypes_enrollment</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'int'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'int'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'int'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'int'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                     <span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="sd">''' There is an issue with the wdegapp column as there are different values and also missing values.</span>
<span class="sd">We will fix that by imputing the empty values with a zero.</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'wdegapp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'wdegapp'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

<span class="n">col_name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dtypes_enrollment</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dtypes_enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="sd">''' Conversion of dtypes for enrollment table seems successful. </span>
<span class="sd">We will now do the same for the award and misc table.</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="n">dtype_award</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'int'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">]</span>


<span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'awardterm'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="sd">'''There seems to be the same issue with the award table for the awardterm column. </span>
<span class="sd">We will fill the empty values with a -99.</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>

<span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'awardterm'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">award</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'awardterm'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'awardterm'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">99.0</span>

<span class="n">col_name_award</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">award</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">col_name_award</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name_award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name_award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dtype_award</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">dtype_misc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'str'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'float'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">col_name_misc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">misc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">col_name_misc</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name_misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">col_name_misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dtype_misc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="sd">''' All tables seem to be clean now. We will now join the three tables on the student id column </span>
<span class="sd">and then export the dataframe into a SQL database</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I started to engineer a few features from here.</p>
<p>First, using the grade each student received in each course, I created a new column that holds the value of the grade, i.e. A = 4.0, B = 3.0, etc.</p>
<p>In attempt to capture the difficulty of each course offered by the college, I looked at the distribution of each course over the span of 10 years and assigned a course weight to each course. For example, if a majority of the students over 10 years earned A's in a course, then the course weight given to that course is a 1. Conversely, a course weight of 5 is given to a course that has a majority of students earning F's.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [84]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Create feature for class difficulty based on prior performance (probability)</span>

<span class="n">course_dist</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">crosstab</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'course'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]</span>
<span class="c1"># course_dist = course_dist.drop('UG', axis = 0)</span>

<span class="c1">#Define course weight</span>

<span class="n">courses</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span>
<span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">courses</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">]])</span>
    

<span class="c1"># index:  A   - 0     Weight: 1</span>
<span class="c1">#         B   - 2     Weight: 2</span>
<span class="c1">#         C/P - 3/10  Weight: 3</span>
<span class="c1">#         D   - 4     Weight: 4 </span>
<span class="c1">#         Rest/F -    Weight 5</span>

<span class="n">course_weight</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">courses</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">count</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">course</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">courses</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'UG'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'B'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'P'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">course_dist</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">course</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'D'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">5</span>
    <span class="n">count</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

<span class="n">enrollment</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'course_weight'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">course_weight</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'course'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">courses</span><span class="p">}),</span>
                              <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'course'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">misc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">enrollment</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">misc</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">award</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop_duplicates</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># Create grade value column to calculate gpa</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'P'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">2.0</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">4.0</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'B'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">3.0</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">2.0</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'D'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span>

<span class="c1"># df.to_csv('student_df.csv')</span>

<span class="c1"># engine = create_engine('postgresql://truong:****@localhost:5432/lbcc_truong')</span>
<span class="c1"># df.to_sql('studentdata',engine, chunksize = 100000)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next, to slice the data to attain only 1st semester of data on each student, it was best to port this cleaned dataset from a csv file to a PostgresSQL database for efficiency and speed.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [85]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_option</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'display.max_columns'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">200</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">con</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">psycopg2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">connect</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dbname</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'lbcc_truong'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">host</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'localhost'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">user</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'postgres'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">password</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'**'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">cur</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">con</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">cursor</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="SQL-Query">SQL Query<a class="anchor-link" href="#SQL-Query">Â¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Find students who have taken at least 3 semesters of courses<ul>
<li>These students will be given label 1 and the students that are not on this list will be given label 0</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Construct dataset of students' first semester data</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>Features that were engineered from enrollments table:<ul>
<li>GPA</li>
<li>Most recent GPA (previous semester)</li>
<li>Average GPA</li>
<li>Total class weight</li>
<li>Maximum number of courses taken (of all semesters)</li>
<li>Minimum number of courses taken (of all semesters)</li>
<li>Total number of degree applicable courses taken</li>
<li>Total number of transferrable courses taken (UC + CSU)</li>
<li>Total units attempted</li>
<li>Total online courses taken</li>
<li>Total classroom courses taken</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [86]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">student_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span>
<span class="sd">SELECT studentid</span>
<span class="sd">FROM(</span>
<span class="sd">    SELECT DISTINCT ON (studentid)</span>
<span class="sd">    studentid, COUNT (term) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) as num_terms</span>
<span class="sd">    FROM studentdata</span>
<span class="sd">    GROUP BY studentid, term</span>
<span class="sd">    ) as x</span>
<span class="sd">WHERE num_terms >= 3</span>
<span class="sd">'''</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">con</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [87]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_sql_query</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'''</span>
<span class="s1">SELECT DISTINCT ON (studentid)</span>
<span class="s1">*,</span>
<span class="s1">AVG(gpa) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS avg_gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(total_course_weight) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_weight,</span>
<span class="s1">MAX(num_courses) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS max_num_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">MIN(num_courses) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS min_num_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(num_courses) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(num_wdegapp) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_wdegapp,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(num_transstat) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_transstat,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(total_semester_units) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_units,</span>
<span class="s1">LAST_VALUE(gpa) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS most_recent_gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">LAST_VALUE(total_gpa) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS overall_gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(num_online_courses) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_online_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">SUM(num_classroom_courses) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS total_classroom_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">MAX(gpa) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS max_gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">MIN(gpa) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS min_gpa</span>
<span class="s1">FROM (</span>
<span class="s1">    SELECT</span>
<span class="s1">    *,</span>
<span class="s1">    gpa_num/(gpa_den + 0.000000001) AS gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">    cumm_gpa_num/(cumm_gpa_den + 0.000000001)  AS total_gpa,</span>
<span class="s1">    FIRST_VALUE (term) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS first_term,</span>
<span class="s1">    max(rank_column) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid) AS max_rank</span>
<span class="s1">    FROM(</span>
<span class="s1">        SELECT DISTINCT ON (studentid, term)</span>
<span class="s1">        studentdata.*,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM(course_weight) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS total_course_weight,</span>
<span class="s1">        COUNT(course) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS num_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">        dense_rank() OVER(PARTITION BY studentid ORDER BY term ASC) AS rank_column,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (grade_value * unitsattempted) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS gpa_num,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (unitsattempted) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS gpa_den,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (grade_value * unitsattempted) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid ORDER BY term) AS cumm_gpa_num,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (unitsattempted) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid ORDER BY term) AS cumm_gpa_den,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (wdegapp) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS num_wdegapp,</span>
<span class="s1">        SUM (unitsattempted) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS total_semester_units,</span>
<span class="s1">        COUNT(CASE WHEN transstat IN ('Transfer to both UC and CSU', 'Transfer to CSU Only') THEN 1 END)</span>
<span class="s1">        OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term) AS num_transstat,</span>
<span class="s1">        COUNT(CASE WHEN location IN ('ZZWEB', 'ZZINTERNET') THEN 1 END) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term)</span>
<span class="s1">        AS num_online_courses,</span>
<span class="s1">        COUNT(CASE WHEN location NOT IN ('ZZWEB', 'ZZINTERNET') THEN 1 END) OVER(PARTITION BY studentid, term)</span>
<span class="s1">        AS num_classroom_courses</span>
<span class="s1">        FROM studentdata</span>
<span class="s1">        ) AS X</span>
<span class="s1">      ) AS Z</span>
<span class="s1">WHERE max_rank >= 1 AND rank_column <= 1</span>
<span class="s1">'''</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">con</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, I will create labels for students returning/not returning for the 3rd semester as well as drop any columns from SQL subqueries and columns that will not be used.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [88]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'first_term'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">1505</span> <span class="p">]</span> <span class="c1">#1525 = Fall 13-14 semester / Spring 16 semester</span>
<span class="n">terms</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'terms.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">fall</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">terms</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Fall</span>
<span class="n">spring</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">terms</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Spring</span>
<span class="n">terms</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fall</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">spring</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># 2 semesters -> 4 semesters</span>
<span class="c1"># df = df.drop(['index','ay','section','unitsattempted','grade','samcode',</span>
<span class="c1">#             'bdnum','firstterm','transstat','course_weight','AwardType','awardterm',</span>
<span class="c1">#             'grade_value','num_courses',</span>
<span class="c1">#             'rank_column','gpa_num','gpa_den','max_rank','gpa', 'max_gpa', 'total_course_weight',</span>
<span class="c1">#              'num_wdegapp','num_transstat','total_semester_units', 'num_online_courses',</span>
<span class="c1">#              'num_classroom_courses', 'first_term', 'cumm_gpa_den','cumm_gpa_num','total_gpa'</span>
<span class="c1">#              ], axis = 1)</span>

<span class="c1"># 1 semesters -> 3 semesters</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">first_term</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isin</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">terms</span><span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'index'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'ay'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'section'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'unitsattempted'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'grade'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'samcode'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="s1">'bdnum'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'firstterm'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'term'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'subject'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'course'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'location'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'plandes'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Major'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'wdegapp'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="s1">'transstat'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'course_weight'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'AwardType'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'awardterm'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'grade_value'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'num_courses'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="s1">'rank_column'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'gpa_num'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'gpa_den'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'max_rank'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'max_gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'total_course_weight'</span><span class="p">,</span>
             <span class="s1">'num_wdegapp'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'num_transstat'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'total_semester_units'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'num_online_courses'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'num_classroom_courses'</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="s1">'first_term'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'cumm_gpa_den'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'cumm_gpa_num'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'total_gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'most_recent_gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'avg_gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="s1">'min_gpa'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'max_num_courses'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'min_num_courses'</span>
             <span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">student_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ones</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">student_list</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">student_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'left'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Dataset-after-SQL-Query">Dataset after SQL Query<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dataset-after-SQL-Query">Â¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>Contains students who attended before term 1505 ( Fall 13-14 Semester) <ul>
<li>Most recent data is Spring 16</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Contains only students that started their first semester in one of the main semesters (Fall or Spring)</li>
<li>Added labels column:<ul>
<li>1 if student returns for a 3rd semester</li>
<li>0 if student does not return for a 3rd semester</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [89]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># df.head(3)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="More-Data-Cleanup">More Data Cleanup<a class="anchor-link" href="#More-Data-Cleanup">Â¶</a></h3><ul>
<li><p>Data entry for the english, math, and reading placements are sloppy, some things have equivalent indication with varying inputs. There are also empty entries for all three placement columns so I will fill the empty entries with an 'unknown' indicator. If I had the students' high school data, I can determine the correct placement.</p>
</li>
<li><p>For the reading, english, math placement columns, many of the entries indicate the same course, just entered with Capital letters, past tense/present tense, spacing, etc. The following codes will just replace everything that indicate the same placement course and pack it into one.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [90]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'englplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">englplacement</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'englplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'unknown_engl'</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">readplacement</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">readplacement</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fillna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'unknown'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'readplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'readplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span>
                       <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Recommend '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
                       <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Recommended '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Reading '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Read '</span><span class="p">)</span>
                       <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'READ 82/83'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Read 82'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'READ '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Read '</span><span class="p">)</span>
                        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">readplacement</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'readplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'unknown_read'</span>


<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mathplacement</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mathplacement</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'MATH '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math '</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'MATH'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Math'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 110,125 or 140'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math110,125 or 140'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 110 ,125 or 140'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or  140'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 110, 125 or 140'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># Math 110, 125, 140</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120, 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120,130 or 115'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120/130 Math Prof Not Met'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120/130 or 115'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120,  130 or 115'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 120,  130 or 115'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 130 or 115'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># Math 130 or 115</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 37/45/STAT1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 37, 45 or STAT 1'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 37, 45 or  STAT1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Math 37, 45 or STAT 1'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 37, 45 or STAT1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'Math 37, 45, or STAT 1'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#Math 37, 45, STAT 1</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 60 Calculus'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 60'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 50 Precalculus'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 50'</span><span class="p">)</span>
     <span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Math 40 Trigonometry'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Math 40'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])]</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'mathplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'mathplacement'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'unknown_math'</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Students attend community college for many reasons. Since this analysis is focused on students who intend to get their transfer degrees, and/or associate degrees. I will subset this data based on education goals. After looking through the awards table, the following were the most frequent education goals stated on the applications of students that finished and earned their degrees.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [91]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edgoaldes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[91]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>array(['Undecided on Goal', 'Obtain a vocational degree without transfer',
       "Obtain a bachelor's degree after completing an associate degree",
       'Improve basic skills in English, reading, writing or mathematics',
       'Learn English (English as a second language classes-ESL)',
       'Prepare for a new career (acquire job skills)',
       'Goal is not listed above',
       "Obtain a bachelor's degree without completing associate degree",
       'Discover/formulate career interests, plans, goals', 'nan',
       'Maintain a certificate or license (nursing, real estate etc)',
       'Obtain an associate degree without transfer',
       'Advance in current job/career (update job skills)',
       'Educational Development (personal enrichment)',
       'Activity or performance class only (i.e. P.E., Drama, Chorus) etc.',
       'Obtain a vocational certificate without transfer',
       "Obtain a bachelor's degree after completing a vocational degree",
       'Complete Credits for a high school diploma or GED',
       '4Yrs College-Meet College Requirements'], dtype=object)</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [92]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Obtain a bachelor</span><span class="se">\'</span><span class="s1">s degree after completing an associate degree'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Undecided on Goal'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Goal is not listed above'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Obtain an associate degree without transfer'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Obtain a bachelor</span><span class="se">\'</span><span class="s1">s degree after completing a vocational degree'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Obtain a vocational degree without transfer'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">|</span>
   <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Obtain a vocational certificate without transfer'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># df = df[(df['highestedlevel'] != 'Currently Enrolled in grades K-10') &</span>
<span class="c1">#    (df['highestedlevel'] != 'Bachelor\'s Degree or higher from a U.S. College') &</span>
<span class="c1">#    (df['highestedlevel'] != 'Currently Enrolled in Adult School') &</span>
<span class="c1">#    (df['highestedlevel'] != 'missing') &</span>
<span class="c1">#    (df['highestedlevel'] != 'Currently Enrolled in Grades 11 or 12')]</span>
<span class="c1"># # # df = df[df['highestedlevel'] == 'High School Graduate or will graduate this semester']</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [93]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># df.to_csv('sql_data.csv')</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [94]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[94]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(84852, 22)</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Subsetting-the-data">Subsetting the data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Subsetting-the-data">Â¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>Subset data based on students' educational goals<ul>
<li>Obtain a bachelor's degree after completing an associate degree </li>
<li>Undecided on Goal</li>
<li>Goal is not listed above</li>
<li>Obtain an associate degree without transfer</li>
<li>Obtain a bachelor's degree after completing a vocational degree</li>
<li>Obtain a vocational degree without transfer</li>
<li>Obtain a vocational certificate without transfer</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here is the list of 22 features we will use for our models. Some of these variables will be changed to binary variables using encoding.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [95]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[95]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>['gender',
 'eth',
 'studentid',
 'wveteran',
 'wbog',
 'wpell',
 'edgoaldes',
 'highestedlevel',
 'firstgeneration',
 'readplacement',
 'englplacement',
 'mathplacement',
 'wfoster',
 'total_weight',
 'total_courses',
 'total_wdegapp',
 'total_transstat',
 'total_units',
 'overall_gpa',
 'total_online_courses',
 'total_classroom_courses',
 'labels']</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Create-Categorical-Variables:">Create Categorical Variables:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Create-Categorical-Variables:">Â¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>Gender</li>
<li>Ethnicity</li>
<li>Reading Placement</li>
<li>Math Placement</li>
<li>Highest Education Level</li>
<li>Educational Goals</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I initially used one hot encoding for the categorical variables. However, after reading on opendatascience.com about the great results of binary encoding, I decided to give it a try. I used the package categorical-encoders to carry out the binary encoding.</p>
<p>The binary encoding process as described by the article: First the categories are encoded as ordinal, then those integers are converted into binary code, then the digits from that binary string are split into separate columns.  This encodes the data in fewer dimensions that one-hot, but with some distortion of the distances.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [96]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># drop_list = ['term','subject','course','location','plandes', 'Major','wdegapp']</span>
<span class="c1"># df = df.drop(drop_list, axis = 1)</span>

<span class="n">dummy_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'gender'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'eth'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'readplacement'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'englplacement'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'mathplacement'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'highestedlevel'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'edgoaldes'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="c1"># df_new = pd.get_dummies(df[dummy_list])</span>
<span class="c1"># df1 = pd.concat([df.drop(dummy_list, axis = 1), df_new], axis = 1)</span>

<span class="n">binary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ce</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">BinaryEncoder</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">binary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dummy_list</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">out</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">binary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">transform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dummy_list</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">df1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">concat</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dummy_list</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">out</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>



<span class="c1">#Convert the -99.0 entries in the first generation column to 0. My guess is that -99 was used for unknown.</span>
<span class="c1"># It should be safe to replace -99 by 0, as not knowing is as good as not first generation in this case. </span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'firstgeneration'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">99.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'firstgeneration'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
<span class="n">df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ix</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'firstgeneration'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">99.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'firstgeneration'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [97]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[97]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>(84852, 41)</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>After creating categorical variables using binary encoding and subsetting the data, the current data size is 84852 students and 41 columns.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Three-Approaches">Three Approaches<a class="anchor-link" href="#Three-Approaches">Â¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>Clustering to identify probabilities </li>
<li>Using personal judgement</li>
<li>Machine learning models</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Clustering">Clustering<a class="anchor-link" href="#Clustering">Â¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>K-Means clustering<ul>
<li>Pattern recognition and unsupervised algorithm: Groups students into "clusters" based on similarities taking into account every feature.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To get an idea of the number of clusters to use, I will use the "elbow method". This method is simply calculating the cost function</p>
\begin{equation*}
\displaystyle \sum_{i = 1}^{k} \sum_{x \in S_i} || x_i - \mu || ^ 2
\end{equation*}<p>for different number of k clusters and determining when the cost function does not decrease marginally.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [98]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">inert</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">cluster_df1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">km_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">KMeans</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_clusters</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">normalize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)))</span>
    <span class="n">inert</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">km_model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">inertia_</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">inert</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of Clusters'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Sum of Squared Error/Cost Function'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">title</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[98]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre><function matplotlib.pyplot.title></pre>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the plot of the sum of squared erorr, it seems like an appropriate number of clusters to use for k-means is 4. After 4 clusters, the sum of squared error decreases at a slower rate compared to the rate before k = 4 clusters.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [195]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">num_clusters</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>
<span class="n">km_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">KMeans</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_clusters</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">num_clusters</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">normalize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'kmeans_labels'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">km_model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">labels_</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num_clusters</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">print</span> <span class="s1">'Percent of students who returned in cluster:'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">kmeans_labels</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">kmeans_labels</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="c1"># cluster_df1[cluster_df1.kmeans_labels == 2].head(4)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Percent of students who returned in cluster: 0 : 0.553328676589
Percent of students who returned in cluster: 1 : 0.604006602947
Percent of students who returned in cluster: 2 : 0.32725631769
Percent of students who returned in cluster: 3 : 0.385058459422
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [100]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">pca</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">PCA</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_components</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">pca_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pca</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_transform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">normalize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'labels'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'studentid'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">kmean_labels</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cluster_df1</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'kmeans_labels'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">plot_kmeans</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3000</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">kmean_labels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'r'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'+'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">kmean_labels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'o'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">kmean_labels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">l3</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'g'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'*'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">kmean_labels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">l4</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">pca_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'m'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'^'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">l1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">l2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">l3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">l4</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'cluster 0'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'cluster 1'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'cluster 2'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'cluster 3'</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">loc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'upper right'</span><span class="p">,</span>
               <span class="n">fontsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="n">borderpad</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">InÂ [101]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plot_kmeans</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
